title: Job Openings at Estrada International Staffing Solutions
content:
Estrada International Staffing Solutions is a strategic boutique specialist recruitment consulting firm, serving clients with expertise recruitment services across all sectors ranging from Banking, Insurance, Oil and Gas, Telecommunications, FMCGs and Construction, with the aim of satisfying their recruitment needs.

We pride ourselves in the finesse we adopt in our recruitment service delivery. We match our clients’ expectations to pool unique talents and enable them effect positive change management which delivers organizational objectives. We also drive positive career growths for our talents.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Business Development Manager (Asset Management)
     

            
    



Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	The Business Development Manager will be responsible for driving the growth of the firm’s deposit and loan portfolio by leveraging existing networks, building new strategic partnerships, and strengthening the firm’s visibility within the financial ecosystem.
	The ideal candidate must have a strong background in financial services (especially banking or asset management) and a deep understanding of loan structuring and fixed deposit mobilization.


Key Responsibilities


	Source and mobilize fixed deposits from individuals and institutions.
	Market and originate structured loan products for qualified clients.
	Manage client relationships to drive product adoption and client retention.
	Identify and close new business opportunities across corporate and individual clients.
	Conduct regular market intelligence and competitor benchmarking.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory and internal risk management standards.
	Work closely with internal teams to ensure seamless service delivery.


Requirements


	A First Degree in Business Administration, Finance, or related fields
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in business development within asset management, commercial banking, or finance houses.
	Proven experience in deposit mobilization and loans structuring.
	Professional certifications will be an added advantage.
	Strong client network in the Lagos financial market.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills.


Salary
N500,000 - N800,000 Net Monthly Pay (depending on experience).

Application Closing Date: 4th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: au.okpaire@estradaintl.com using "BDM – Asset Management Application" as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Welder

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Contract

Job Summary


	They are seeking an experienced Welder with at least 4 years’ experience in maintenance and metal works for hospitality facilities.
	Candidate must be skilled in welding and general fabrication.


Key Duties


	Weld and repair gates, frames, kitchen fittings, etc.
	Interpret technical drawings and carry out fabrication.
	Perform routine maintenance and emergency repairs.
	Ensure all work meets safety and quality standards.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an SSCE / GCE / NECO.
	Minimum 4 years in welding.


Salary
N80,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 5th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: m.okhipo@estradaintl.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Sales Coordinator

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Supervise and guide field agents responsible for scouting and onboarding neighborhood distributors.
	Set sales targets and monitor agent performance.
	Identify and engage potential distributors, retailers, and bulk buyers.
	Build community-level partnerships to expand market reach.
	Maintain a database of leads and onboarded partners.
	Provide regular performance updates and support field execution.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 1 - 2 years of experience.


Salary
N100,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 29th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: i.ayorinde@estradaintl.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Vacancies at Laprenge staffings Solutions
content:
Laprenge staffings Solutions is a leading provider of Human Resources and HR solutions, dedicated to empowering businesses and individuals through cutting-edge products and services. Our mission is to drive growth, efficiency, and success in a rapidly evolving digital space.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Personal Assistant

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess an HND / B.Sc Degree with 2 - 3 years of work experience. 


Application Closing Date: 10th August, 2025.
     

            
    



Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: laprengecandidate@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

2.) Content Creator

Job Location: Lagos Mainland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We're seeking a talented Content Creator to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing high-quality, engaging content across various platforms, including social media, blogs, and websites.


Key Responsibilities


	Create compelling content (text, images, videos) that resonates with our target audience.
	Develop and implement content strategies to drive engagement and conversions.
	Conduct research to stay up-to-date on industry trends and best practices.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure brand consistency.
	Optimise content for SEO and analytics.


Requirements


	Strong writing, editing, and visual creation skills.
	Experience with content management systems (CMS).
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines. 


What We Offer


	Opportunity to work with a dynamic team.
	Professional development and growth opportunities.
	Flexible work


Application Closing Date: 10th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: laprengecandidate@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Human Resources Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We're seeking an experienced HR professional to join our team.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for managing and implementing HR initiatives, policies, and procedures to support the organization's growth and success.


Key Responsibilities


	Recruitment and Talent Acquisition: Manage job postings, interviews, and hiring processes.
	Employee Relations: Handle employee conflicts, grievances, and performance issues.
	Benefits and Compensation: Administer employee benefits, compensation, and payroll.
	Training and Development: Design and deliver training programs to enhance employee skills.
	Policy Development: Develop, implement, and communicate HR policies and procedures.
	Compliance: Ensure compliance with labor laws, regulations, and company policies.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 3 - 5 years of work experience.


Application Closing Date: 14th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: laprengecandidate@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquiries, contact 08146153631, WhatsApp only.

title: Job Vacancies at RA Trading and Investment
content:
RA Trading and Investment - Our Think Design is Nigeria's foremost manufacturer of custom interior designs. R.A. Think Design is an Israeli-Nigerian Interior Design and Custom-made Furniture company that caters to commercial and residential projects.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sprayer

Job Location: Ketu Ikosi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are currently seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Sprayer to join our production team.
	The Sprayer will be responsible for applying finishes, stains, and protective coatings to furniture components and products using various spraying equipment and techniques.


Job Descriptions


	Prepare furniture surfaces for finishing by sanding, cleaning, and applying appropriate primers or sealers as needed.
	Operate spraying equipment, including airless sprayers, HVLP (High Volume Low Pressure) sprayers, and electrostatic sprayers, to apply stains, paints, lacquers, and other finishes to furniture components and products.
	Mix and prepare finishing materials according to specified formulas, ensuring proper viscosity, color matching, and consistency.
	Apply finishes to furniture surfaces in accordance with production schedules and quality standards, achieving desired color, sheen, and coverage.
	Monitor spraying equipment for proper functioning and perform routine maintenance tasks such as cleaning, calibrating, and replacing worn parts.
	Inspect finished products for defects, runs, or imperfections, and make necessary adjustments to spraying equipment or techniques to ensure quality results.


Requirements


	High school diploma or equivalent required; additional training or certification in finishing techniques or woodworking preferred.
	Proven experience (5 years) working as a sprayer in a furniture manufacturing or woodworking environment.
	Proficiency in operating various types of spraying equipment and familiarity with different types of finishes, stains, and coatings.
	Strong attention to detail and ability to achieve consistent, high-quality finishes on furniture surfaces.
	Ability to interpret technical drawings, specifications, and finishing instructions.


Salary
N80,000 - N120,000 Monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: admin@ra-nigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

2.) Factory Assistant / Labourer

Job Location: Ketu Ikosi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for Factory Assistants to provides essential support and ensure the production process runs smoothly.
	Role includes material handling, assisting machine operators, assisting in assembling furniture parts, maintaining cleanliness of company environment and the work area, and performing quality checks.


Responsibilities


	Assist in the assembly and production of furniture pieces according to specifications.
	Operate or assist with machinery under supervision, including saws, drills, and sanders.
	Move and organize raw materials, semi-finished goods, and finished products in the production area.
	Follow health, safety, and quality standards and comply with company policies.
	Maintain a clean, safe, and organized work area.
	Pack and prepare products for shipping, ensuring correct labeling and packaging.
	Report any equipment malfunctions or safety hazards to the supervisor.


Requirements


	Technical school certificate / vocational training woodworking or manufacturing is a plus
	Minimum of a year experience in a factory or manufacturing environment, preferably in furniture or woodworking, is an advantage
	Physical stamina to perform repetitive tasks and lift materials up to a specified weight limit.
	Strong attention to detail and commitment to quality.
	Ability to follow instructions and work well in a team environment.
	Reliability and punctuality.
	Good communication skills for effective collaboration.
	A proactive attitude toward learning new tasks and improving efficiency.


Salary
N70,000 Monthly. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: admin@ra-nigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

3.) Furniture Maker

Job Location: Ketu Ikosi Road, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a qualified Carpenter to cut, fabricate and install wooden and other structures according to specifications. Your job will entail working in the factory to produce quality and functional furniture products


Responsibilities


	Read and understand blueprints, sketches, and design specifications.
	Choose appropriate materials (wood, metal, fabric, etc.) based on design and functionality.
	Inspect materials for quality and suitability.
	Ensure joints are secure and pieces fit together correctly.
	Inspect completed pieces for accuracy, quality, and adherence to design specifications.
	Make necessary adjustments or repairs.
	Maintain and repair tools and equipment.
	Keep the work area clean and organized.
	Work closely with other team members, including designers, carpenters, and finishers.
	Measure and mark materials according to specifications.
	Use hand tools, power tools, and machinery to cut, shape, and form parts.
	Assemble parts using nails, screws, adhesives, and other fasteners.
	Provide input on design improvements and production processes.
	Use protective equipment and ensure a safe working environment.
	Maintain detailed logs of work processes and completed tasks.


Qualifications


	Minimum of SSCE and Completion of a recognized apprenticeship or a minimum of 5 years of experience as a carpenter.
	Additional certification like a trade test may be required
	An analytical mind for problem-solving
	The ability to work alone or as part of a small team
	Ability to follow instructions closely
	Attention to detail.


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: admin@ra-nigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
